reviews.title: Island of Dreams?
reviews.text: We have visited the Scilly Isles in general, and the Island Hotel in particular, on and off for 40 years so I guess we like the place!

reviews.title: Paradise Island
reviews.text: But I must make it clear from the outset that this place isn't for everyone. If you like busy, action packed resorts and five-star pampering then go somewhere else! This place is for people who like beautiful, natural landscapes and seascapes.

reviews.title: High quality hide away
reviews.text: The island also gets some criticism for its "1950s feel", but this is also the very reason many people keep coming back. You really can leave your doors unlocked here!

reviews.title: Unique gem
reviews.text: So what are the highlights of staying at the hotel:

reviews.title: Tranquility
reviews.text: 1. The island itself. Two miles by one, 150 residents, no cars, one pub, beautiful (almost empty) beaches and the fantastic Abbey Gardens. If you like walking, this place is a delight with an amazing variey of scenery for such a small island.

reviews.title: Island paradise
reviews.text: What a delight and what a find. We stayed here for a couple of days over the summer and were blessed with constant sunshine and non-stop warmth from all quarters.
